data.title: MLB Teams – List of Baseball Teams, Stats and Upcoming Events
data.meta_description: There are 30 MLB teams: Atlanta Braves, Miami Marlins, New York Mets, Philadelphia Phillies, Washington Nationals, Chicago Cubs, Cincinnati Reds, Milwaukee Brewers, Pittsburgh Pirates, St. Louis Cardinals
data.text:
MLB Teams: Major League Baseball is a professional baseball organization and the oldest major professional sports league in the United States and Canada. It is composed of 30 teams divided evenly between the American League (AL) and the National League (NL), which are further subdivided into three divisions each: East, Central, and West.

How many MLB teams are there?

There are 30 MLB teams, divided evenly with 15 teams in the American League (AL) and 15 teams in the National League (NL).

Each of the leagues is divided into three divisions called the East, the Central, and the West.

MLB teams Upcoming Events

Major League Baseball (MLB) hosts a variety of exciting events throughout the year that bring teams and fans together in unique and memorable ways. From international games to historic ballpark matchups, these events highlight the global reach and rich history of baseball. Whether you’re a die-hard fan or new to the sport, these events offer a chance to see top-tier baseball action, celebrate the sport’s heritage, and enjoy the talents of current and future stars.

Here are the upcoming events of MLB teams.

MLB World Tour: London Series

The New York Mets and Philadelphia Phillies will play a two-game series at London Stadium on June 8-9, 2024.

Location: London, England

Dates: June 8-9, 2024

MLB at Rickwood Field

Rickwood Field, the oldest professional ballpark in the United States and former home of the Birmingham Black Barons of the Negro Leagues, will host a special Regular Season game between the St. Louis Cardinals and San Francisco Giants on June 20, 2024.

VIP Ticket Packages Available

Location: Rickwood Field, Birmingham, Alabama

Date: June 20, 2024

HBCU Swingman Classic presented by T-Mobile

The HBCU Swingman Classic presented by T-Mobile and powered by the MLB-MLBPA Youth Development Foundation is an annual All-Star event for baseball student-athletes from Division-I programs at Historically Black Colleges & Universities to showcase their talent on a national stage.

Location: Arlington, Texas

Date: July 12, 2024

2024 MLB Draft

For the fourth consecutive year, the MLB Draft will take place during MLB All-Star Week. The opening night of the Draft will be held on Sunday, July 14 at the historic Cowtown Coliseum in the heart of the Fort Worth Stockyards and will be open to the public. The rest of the Draft will take place on Monday, July 15, and Tuesday, July 16.

Location: Arlington, Texas

Dates: July 14-16, 2024

MLB All-Star Game presented by Mastercard

MLB stars of the present and future will shine during All-Star Week in Arlington, with events including the 94th MLB All-Star Game presented by Mastercard, the T-Mobile Home Run Derby, the Sirius XM All-Star Futures Game, the MLB Draft, and more.

VIP Ticket Packages Available

Location: Arlington, Texas

Dates: July 12-16, 2024

How many players are on an MLB team?

In MLB teams, there are two key rosters to understand: the 26-man roster and the 40-man roster. The 26-man roster includes the main group of players who actively participate in games throughout most of the season. On the other hand, the 40-man roster is broader and includes the 26-man roster plus additional players under major league contracts. These extra players could be minor leaguers or individuals on the injured list. Members of the 40-man roster are eligible to be “called up” to the 26-man roster as needed. Furthermore, starting in September, the rules relax a bit, allowing any of the players from the 40-man roster to be active in games, effectively expanding the main roster temporarily.

Baseball Rules

Here are some basic MLB (Major League Baseball) rules explained:

The Game’s Goal: The main aim is to score more runs than the other team. A run is scored when a player hits the ball and runs around four bases to reach home plate.

Teams and Turns: There are two teams. One team bats, trying to score runs, while the other team fields and tries to stop them. They switch roles after the batting team has three outs.

Hitting and Running: The batting team tries to hit the ball thrown by the pitcher from the fielding team. If the batter hits the ball, they run to as many bases as they can before the ball is returned.

Getting Outs: The fielding team tries to get the batting team’s players out by catching the ball before it touches the ground, tagging runners with the ball before they reach a base, or throwing the ball to a base before the runner gets there.

Innings: The game is divided into nine parts called innings. Each team gets to bat once in each inning. The team with the most runs at the end wins.

Strikes and Balls: A strike is when the batter misses the ball or hits it out of the play area. A ball is when the pitch is outside the strike zone, and the batter doesn’t swing. Three strikes and the batter is out; four balls and the batter walks to first base.

Home Runs: If the batter hits the ball out of the field in fair territory, it’s a home run, and they can walk around the bases to score a run, along with any team members already on bases.

Fun Facts about MLB Teams

Different Colors: Each MLB team has its own special colors and designs for their uniforms. Some teams’ colors are really bright and easy to see!

Old Teams: The Atlanta Braves are the oldest continuously playing team in professional American sports. They started playing way back in 1871.

Big Hits: The New York Yankees have won the most World Series championships. They have won 27 times, which is a lot more than any other team.

Long Games: Baseball games can last a long time, but one game between the Boston Red Sox and the Brooklyn Robins in 1920 was super long. It took 26 innings! That’s like playing almost three regular games back to back.

Flying Far: In baseball, when someone hits the ball really hard, it can go very far. The longest home run ever hit went over 575 feet. That’s almost as long as two football fields.

MLB Teams – List of Baseball Teams, Stats and Upcoming Events – FAQs

Are there 32 MLB teams?

The Arizona Diamondbacks and Tampa Bay Devil Rays joined the league for a $130 million expansion fee as MLB’s 29th and 30th teams. More than a quarter-century later, MLB remains a 30-team league.

What’s the newest MLB team?

Arizona Diamondbacks and Tampa Bay Rays (then Tampa Bay Devil Rays) were the most recent expansion teams in the MLB. Both of them joined MLB in 1998.

What is the oldest team in MLB?

The Atlanta Braves are the oldest continually operating team in Major League Baseball; enfranchised in 1871 as the Boston Red Stockings (or Red Caps) in National Association, and with connections to the original independent professional Cincinnati Red Stockings of 1869–70; joined National League as charter member.

How many games in baseball?

The Major League Baseball (MLB) season schedule consists of 162 games for each of the 30 teams in the American League (AL) and National League (NL), played over approximately six months – a total of 2,430 games, plus the postseason.

How many innings are in baseball?

In each half, one team bats until three outs are made, with the other team playing defense. A full baseball game is typically scheduled for nine innings, while softball games consist of seven innings, although this may be shortened due to weather or extended if the score is tied at the end of the scheduled innings.

What is the difference between NL and Al?

The only big difference between the National League and the American League (AL) was that the AL used the “Designated Hitter” (or DH). The Designated Hitter is a player who does not play in the field, but is used to bat for the pitcher.
